intro: Heteropterys platyptera var. borealis, commonly known as the northern broadleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of North America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and stream banks. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and its role in supporting local pollinators.
